doc.previous: More generally for a lottery with many possible options
doc.after: where  By making some reasonable assumptions about the way choices behave von Neumann and Morgenstern showed that if an agent can choose between the lotteries then this agent has a utility function which can be added and multiplied by real numbers which means the utility of an arbitrary lottery can be calculated as a linear combination of the utility of its parts
